content.text: This section provides standardized templates and operational tools designed to support consistent implementation of policies, procedures, and practices across all Eduversal Partner Schools. These templates serve as practical resources that enable principals and school leadership teams to maintain compliance with Indonesian regulations, Cambridge International requirements, and CIS/WASC accreditation standards while ensuring efficient daily operations.

content.title: Template Design Principles
items: Compliance-Ready: Templates incorporate required elements for Indonesian MoE, Cambridge, and CIS/WASC requirements.
EAL-Friendly: Language is clear and accessible; bilingual versions available where appropriate.
Contextually Adaptable: Schools may customize templates to reflect local context while maintaining core elements.
Evidence-Generating: Templates create documentation suitable for accreditation evidence portfolios.
EduNav-Compatible: Templates align with EduNav platform fields and reporting structures.

content.label: Template Repository Organization
content.text: Templates are organized by functional area and cross-referenced to relevant handbook sections. Schools should maintain both digital and physical copies of completed templates according to the records retention requirements outlined in Section 14. The Eduversal Template Repository in EduNav serves as the central location for accessing current versions and submitting completed forms.

subsections.title: Strategic Planning and School Improvement Templates

content.title: Templates
items: T-01 Strategic Plan Template: 3-5 year strategic direction aligned to vision, mission, and SLOs.
T-02 School Improvement Plan (SIP): annual priorities, success criteria, metrics, budget, and accountability.
T-04 PDSA Cycle Documentation: PLAN-DO-STUDY-ACT cycle with evidence and decisions.

content.title: Templates
items: T-05 Board Meeting Agenda: opening, strategic items, governance items, financial oversight, safeguarding, closing.
T-07 Conflict of Interest Declaration: annual declaration and update requirement within 30 days of material change.

content.title: Templates
items: T-08 Safeguarding Concern/Incident Form: reporter, student, concern details, DSL response, and critical reminders.
T-09 Low-Level Concern Log: pattern tracking for boundary/professional conduct concerns and monthly DSL review.
T-11 Safer Recruitment Checklist: controls across advertisement, application, interview, checks, and induction.

subsections.title: Inclusion, EAL, and Learning Support Templates

content.title: Templates
items: T-12 IEP Template: student profile, SMART goals, interventions, accommodations, and progress monitoring.
T-15 CEFR Language Profile: proficiency tracking, CEFR descriptors (A1-C2), differentiation strategies, and progress notes.

subsections.title: Teaching Quality and Professional Practice Templates

content.title: Templates
items: T-17 Lesson Observation Rubric and Form: observation details plus Domains 1-4 and rating scale (Unsatisfactory to Distinguished).
T-20 Professional Development Plan (PDP): individual goals, activities, and end-of-year review outcomes.

content.title: Templates
items: T-21 Moderation Cover Sheet: panel, sampling, standardization, findings, actions, and sign-off.
T-23 Examination Incident Report: incident classification, factual narrative, immediate actions, evidence, Cambridge reporting, and follow-up.

content.text: Moderation sample size guideline: minimum 10% or 10 scripts, whichever is greater.

content.title: Templates
items: T-28 Trip/Activity Risk Assessment: activity profile, participant ratios, controls, emergency contacts, required documents, approvals.
T-31 Risk Register: risk categories, likelihood-impact scoring, and review schedule.

content.title: Templates
items: T-32 Parent-Teacher Conference Agenda: preparation and 15-20 minute conference structure.
T-34 Complaints Procedure Form: intake, complaint stage, investigation, resolution, lessons learned, and sign-off.

content.text: Templates in this section support compliance with Indonesian regulatory expectations, Cambridge requirements, and CIS/WASC accreditation processes.

content.title: Evidence Storage and Organization
items: Store completed templates in EduNav with appropriate access control.
Retain signed originals (e.g., safeguarding and conflict forms) in secure physical files where required.
Use naming convention: [TemplateCode][Subject/Area][Date]_[Version] (e.g., T-17_Math10_2025-03-15_v1).
Apply retention periods from Section 14.5, including extended safeguarding retention.

content.title: Accreditation Visit Preparation
items: Sample completed templates demonstrating consistent implementation.
Aggregated data summaries from template inputs.
Evidence of template review and improvement cycles.
Staff training records on template use.

content.title: Template Review and Updates
items: Annual review by Eduversal Academic Team.
School modification proposals via General Manager.
Version control and changelog maintained in EduNav.
Updates communicated through Principal Network and EduNav notifications.
